column4: I have a process that I need to kill that I cant kill. $ sudo kill -kill <PID> didn't work. sudo killall didnt work. any other ideas?
try via system monitor - though if sudo kill is not working i doubt it will
System monitor did the trick. that's annoying since sometimes I cant get into the system monitor. What does the system monitor do that I wasnt doing from the command line?
maybe you got the pid wrong?
